intro: Polysphaeria pedunculata, commonly known as the slender spore plant, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces spores in specialized structures called sporocarps, which are borne on short, branched peduncles. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions on rocks or soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on bryophyte morphology and ecology.
